header.title: os_mon

description.p: The operating system monitor, OS_Mon, provides the following services:

list.item: cpu_sup CPU load and utilization supervision (Unix)
os_sup Interface to OS system messages (Solaris, Windows)

description.p: To simplify usage of OS_Mon on distributed Erlang systems, it is not considered an error trying to use a service at a node where it is not available (either because OS_Mon is not running, or because the service is not available for that OS, or because the service is not started). Instead, a warning message is issued via error_logger and a dummy value is returned, which one is specified in the man pages for the respective services.

section.title: Configuration
section.p: When OS_Mon is started, by default all services available for the OS, except os_sup, are automatically started. This configuration can be changed using the following application configuration parameters:

item.p: Specifies if cpu_sup should be started. Defaults to true.
Specifies if disksup should be started. Defaults to true.
Specifies if memsup should be started. Defaults to true.
Specifies if os_sup should be started. Defaults to false.

section.p: Configuration parameters effecting the different OS_Mon services are described in the respective man pages.
See config(4) for information about how to change the value of configuration parameters.

section.title: SNMP MIBs
section.p: The following MIBs are defined in OS_Mon:

item.p: This MIB contains objects for instrumentation of disk, memory and CPU usage of the nodes in the system.

section.p: The MIB is stored in the mibs directory. It is defined in SNMPv2 SMI syntax. An SNMPv1 version of the MIB is delivered in the mibs/v1 directory.

The compiled MIB is located under priv/mibs, and the generated .hrl file under the include directory. To compile a MIB that IMPORTS the OTP-OS-MON-MIB, give the option {il, ["os_mon/priv/mibs"]} to the MIB compiler.

If the MIB should be used in a system, it should be loaded into an agent with a call to os_mon_mib:load(Agent), where Agent is the pid or registered name of an SNMP agent. Use os_mon_mib:unload(Agent) to unload the MIB. The implementation of this MIB uses Mnesia to store a cache with data needed, which implicates that Mnesia must be up and running. The MIB also use functions defined for the OTP-MIB, thus that MIB must be loaded as well.

section.title: See Also
